intro: Galium volgense, commonly known as Volga bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia and parts of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium volgense is often found in moist meadows, riverbanks, and other damp habitats.
